intro: Dahlgrenia, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae. It is native to parts of Australia and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Dahlgrenia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and have been used in traditional medicine by Indigenous communities. Due to habitat loss and overharvesting, several species are now threatened with extinction.
